lines.content: * The main class for the ChatBuddy program.
* Handles the initialization of UI, storage, and task list components, and runs the chatbot.
* Constructs a ChatBuddy object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file to store task data.
* Starts the ChatBuddy chatbot, reading and executing commands from the user
* until the user issues the "bye" command.
* The main entry point of the program.
* Represents a command to add a task (ToDo, Deadline, or Event) to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the given description and task type.
* @param type The task type ("T" for ToDo, "D" for Deadline, "E" for Event).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChatBuddyException {
throw new ChatBuddyException("The due date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new ChatBuddyException("The start time or end time of an event cannot be empty.");
* Represents an executable command in the ChatBuddy program.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks The task list to execute the command on.
* @param ui The UI to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage to load/save tasks.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If there is an error while executing the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChatBuddyException;
* Indicates whether this command causes the application to exit.
* @return True if the command causes the application to exit, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the provided index is not a valid number.
* Executes the delete command, removing the task from the task list and updating the storage.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the task index is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChatBuddyException {
throw new ChatBuddyException("Task number out of range.");
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the exit command, displaying the farewell message.
* @param tasks   The task list (unused in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface to display the farewell message.
* @param storage The storage (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Returns true, indicating that this command will terminate the application.
* @return true as the command will exit the application.
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command, displaying the tasks in the task list.
* @param ui      The user interface to display the tasks.
* @param storage The storage (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified index of the task to be marked as done.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the provided index is not a valid number.
* Executes the mark command, marking the task as done and updating the storage.
* @param ui      The user interface to display the updated task status.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the task index is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChatBuddyException {
throw new ChatBuddyException("Task number out of range.");
* Represents a command to unmark a task as done.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified index of the task to be unmarked as done.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked as done.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the provided index is not a valid number.
* Executes the unmark command, unmarking the task as done and updating the storage.
* @param ui      The user interface to display the updated task status.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ChatBuddyException If the task index is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ChatBuddyException {
throw new ChatBuddyException("Task number out of range.");
* Represents exceptions specific to the ChatBuddy application.

* Handles the loading and saving of tasks to and from the storage file.

throw new ChatBuddyException("Invalid task type in file.");

* Displays a message when a new task is added.

* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
